div1.p: Lazear describes his return trip to Baltimore and provides family news.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 12, 1897
div1.p:
I reached
here last night
after a rather
tiresome long journey
I would advise you
to come at night
or break the journey
at New York.

Aunt Kate is well.
Alex and Francis
are in the Blue
Mountains. Uncle Tom
has not yet arrived.

I find our house in very
good condition.

They say the summer has
not been hot. There has
been plenty of rain and
everything looks fresh.

Mrs. Stewart is in town and
I shall call on her.
